creator: bonny.rais@siemens.com.au
text:
When using pattern matching, for example as arguments to the Copy task, 
The match process fails if the pattern and tested string differ in case.
For example, specifying '*.mf' as the pattern and matching against
MANIFEST.MF, on a Windows OS which preseves case but does not distinguish
it, the match fails as the pattern and tested string characters are 
tested against each other, and no regard is given to case sensitivity for
the current OS.

A solution would be to add the following lines to the top of the match method 
(DirectoryScanner.java:427):

   if ( System.getProperty("os.name").toLowerCase().indexOf("windows") >= 0 ) {
       pattern = pattern.toLowerCase();
       str = str.toLowerCase();
   }

Or, there could be another property defined and set at run-time which determined
the case comparison method (ignored or not) and using it as the condition in the
test above
